name: A list of presents for Native Americans purchased by Meriwether Lewis in preparation for his expedition, 1803.

citation.text: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration.
“List of Indian Presents Purchased by Meriwether Lewis in Preparation for the Expedition to the West,” Digital Public Library of America, https://dp.la/item/2638c6ebd7901dd8aab8f24c408918b0.

text:
The list includes four dozen butcher knives, twelve dozen pocket looking-glasses, seventy-two pairs of striped ribbons, and eight brass kettles.

Transcription:

**Indian presents**

[header of first numeric column of table] no.  
12 Pipe Tomahawks . . . . . 8 ¾ . . . x 18 "  
6 ½  lb Strips Sheet Iron . . . . .6 ½ . . .x 1.62    
1 p. red flannel 47 ½ yd . . . . . 12 3/4 . 5 . 12 . 0 . x 14.94      
11 ps. Handkerchief ass[orted]. . . . . . 13 lb . 22 . 8 . 9 . x 59.83  
1 doz Ivory Combs . . . . 3 oz . 1 . 5 . 0 . x 3.33  
½ Catty Indn. S. Silk . . . . 7 oz . 1 . 8 . 1 ½ . x 3.75  
21 lb Tread ass[orted]. . . . . . 21 lb. 8. 13. 9. x 23.17     
1 ps. Scarlet Cloth 22 yd . . . . . 28 ¾ . 21 . 18 . 9 . x 58.50  
5 ½ doz fan: Hos ---------- 6 3.4} . . 7 . 1.  6 . x 18.87  
6 Gro[cer]: Binding . . . . . 9 ¼ }. . 4. 8. 5. x 11.79               
2 Cards Beads . . . . . 1 ¾} . 26 ½ . 1 . 8 . 6 . x 3.80  
4 doz: Butcher Knives ---------- 8 ¼ } .  . 2 . 0 . 0 . x 5.33  
12 doz. Pocket Looking Glass . . . . . 12 ½ lb . . . x 5.19  
15 doz. Pewter " " . . . . . 3 6/16 . . . x 3.99  
8 doz. Burning " " . . . . . 11 ¼ . . . x 12. ..  
2 doz . Nonsopretty . . . . . ¾ . . . x 2.94  
2 doz. Red Striped tapes[?] . . . . . 1 ½ . . . x 2.50  
72 ps Striped silk ribbon . . . . . 3 ¼ . . . x 39.60  
3 lb red Beads . . . . . 3 [illegible] . . . x 2.01   
6 Paper[?] Small Bells [illegible crossed out] . . . . . 1 ¼ . . . x 4.02  
1 box with 100 larger " " . . . . . . 1 3/16 . . . x 2.25  
73 B[?] Beads ass[orted] . . . . . 20 . . . x 41. ..  
3 ½ doz Tinsel Beads ass[orted] . . . . . 9 oz[?] . . . x 3.75  
1 # Thread [crossed out]  
1 doz: Needle cases . . . . 5 ½ oz . . . x .30  
2 /34 doz Lockets . . . . . 3 oz . . . x 3.56  
8 ½ [illegible] Red Beads . . . . . 8 ½ . . . x 25.50  
2 doz: Earrings . . . . . . . . . x 1. ..  
8 Brass kettles . . . . [illegible crossed out] 24/[illegible] 19 20 . 3 4 . 16 0 . x 10.14 10.67  
12 lb Brass Strips . . . . 12 lb . 2 . 11 . 0 . x 6.80  
500 Broaches . . . . . } . . . . x 62.07  
72 Rings . . . . . } 1 ½ lb } . . . x 6.00  
2 Corn Mills . . . . 52 ¾ . . . x 20.00  
15 doz: Scissors[?] . . . . . 17 ¼} [illegible crossed out] . . . x 18.97

isRelatedTo.name: A drawing by expedition sergeant Patrick Gass in 1807 of the men building their camps as they traveled.
A map of the Lewis and Clark expedition route overlaid on a map of the US in 1945.
A US dollar coin, minted in 2000, showing Lewis and Clark’s Shoshone guide, Sacagawea.
A 1903 map of the land gained through the Louisiana Purchase.
A picture of a Shoshone women and children, circa 1888-1892.
A photo of Mandan lodge made of sod similar to ones encountered by the Lewis and Clark Expedition.
A portrait of William Clark, circa 1790-1820.
A portrait of Thomas Jefferson, who was president when the Louisiana Territory was purchased and commissioned Lewis and Clark’s expedition.
A photograph of a 1905 sculpture of Sacagawea by Alice Cooper located in Portland, Oregon.
A photograph of a portrait of Captain Meriwether Lewis, 1918.
A letter from Meriwether Lewis requesting payment for supplies used on the Lewis and Clark expedition, 1806.
A letter from Meriwether Lewis to President James Madison about Lewis’s journey to deliver papers to Washington, 1809.
